meanings.definition: To shrink (fabric) before it is used or sold.
meanings.sent1: I preshrink my new clothes to avoid surprises after washing.
meanings.sent2: It is important to preshrink the fabric before sewing the dress.
meanings.sent3: The fabric decided to preshrink itself in the dryer, much to my dismay.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement seemed to preshrink as she realized the shirt had shrunk.
meanings.sent5: The preshrinking process made the fabric snug and ready for sewing.

meanings.definition: The process of shrinking fabric before it is used or sold.
meanings.sent1: Before sewing, remember the preshrink to prevent future issues.
meanings.sent2: The preshrink of the fabric ensures a perfect fit for the final product.
meanings.sent3: The preshrink of the fabric made it look like a miniaturized version of itself.
meanings.sent4: The preshrink of the fabric was like a magic trick, making it smaller but better.
meanings.sent5: The preshrink of the fabric was a crucial step in the garment-making process.
